title: 108_s1582
content: The Act titled "Valles Caldera Preservation Act of 2004" includes amendments to the Valles Caldera Preservation Act. The Valles Caldera Preservation Act of 2004 includes amendments related to the acquisition of outstanding mineral interests, specifying the process, administration, and funding for such acquisitions. The Valles Caldera Preservation Act of 2004 outlines the process for the Secretary to acquire interests if unsuccessful after 60 days. Any difference in compensation will be paid from a permanent judgment appropriation. The Trust will determine obligations and expenditures in accordance with applicable laws. The Valles Caldera Preservation Act of 2004 empowers the Trust to determine obligations and expenditures, solicit donations through designated personnel, and use proceeds from claims or settlements on the Baca Ranch or Preserve after October 27, 1999. SEC. 3. BOARD OF TRUSTEES. Section 107(e) of the Valles Caldera Preservation Act (U.S.C. 698v-5(e)) is amended to specify the selection and compensation of trustees, with the chair potentially receiving compensation at a rate determined by the Board of Trustees. The Valles Caldera Preservation Act is amended to specify the compensation of trustees, with the chair's pay capped at 25% of the annual rate for level IV of the Executive Schedule. SEC. 4. RESOURCE MANAGEMENT. Property Disposal Limitations amended under the Valles Caldera Preservation Act to exclude the sale of forage, forest products, or renewable resources. The Valles Caldera Preservation Act is amended to exclude the sale of forage, forest products, or renewable resources. Amendments are made to sections regarding law enforcement and fire management, specifying the roles of the Secretary and the Trust. The Secretary, in consultation with the Trust, will develop a plan for fire preparedness, suppression, and emergency rehabilitation on the Preserve. The plan must align with the management program and will be carried out under a cooperative agreement between the Secretary and the Trust. The Secretary may provide presuppression and nonemergency rehabilitation and restoration services for the Trust on a reimbursable basis. The Senate passed the bill on September 15, 2004. Attest: EMILY J. REYNOLDS, Secretary.
